title: Inside Scoop SF
text: Cafe St. Jorge gets new owners on Mission Street By Justin Phillips on January 12, 2017 at 3:25 PM Andrea de Francisco, founder of Cafe St. Jorge on Mission Street, is handing her Portuguese-inspired cafe over to new owners. The cafe went up for sale about a year and a half ago, de Francisco … AQ to officially close Jan. 14 By Justin Phillips on January 12, 2017 at 3:20 PM AQ has set a date for its finale, and will serve its final dinner on Saturday, Jan. 14. Owner Matt Semmelhack said that once word of their pending closure spread — via Thrillist’s recent piece … Almanac Beer Co.’s Ferry Plaza pop-ups start this Saturday By Sarah Fritsche on January 12, 2017 at 12:00 PM This Saturday (Jan. 15), popular Bay Area Beer producer Almanac will launch a new weekly pop-up stand at the Ferry Plaza’s Saturday farmers market. The brewery’s presence on the Embarcadero follows … Kinjo ready to bring $120 omakase to Polk Street By Justin Phillips on January 11, 2017 at 2:18 PM The Bay Area’s omakase craze continues this month in Russian Hill with the Jan. 24 opening of Kinjo, a traditional Japanese spot with Michelin-starred chef Takatoshi Toshi heading up the kitchen. … San Francisco’s first Halal Guys set to open in Union Square By Justin Phillips on January 11, 2017 at 2:15 PM The Halal Guys, New York City’s immensely popular street eats brand, will officially open its first brick-and-mortar in San Francisco on Jan. 27. The new spot, located at 340 O’Farrell St. in the … Rum & Sugar debuts in Tenderloin By Justin Phillips on January 10, 2017 at 2:54 PM Rum & Sugar quietly opened several weeks ago in the Tenderloin. Owners Olga Zhuravskaya and Natasha Avtonomova said they’ve been using the time to test the drink flavors, tweak the menu and … Daniel Patterson’s Minnesota Street Project restaurant will be the city’s second Alta By Justin Phillips on January 10, 2017 at 10:36 AM News of Daniel Patterson’s new restaurant and bar at the Minnesota Street Project came out last spring, and now comes word of its concept: It’s going to be a almost-identical recreation of Alta in …
